quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Monty Python and President
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, presidents, grail. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following pairs contains a U.S. president and a vice president both not having been elected to the office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ford and Rockefeller

questions.question: Which of these words is not sacred to the Knights of Ni, featured in the movie Monty Python and the Holy Grail?
This 9th U.S. President served a term of only 31 days.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Harrison

questions.question: Which President was the first to be elected by women?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Warren Harding

questions.question: In Monty Python and the Holy Grail, Sir Bedeveres Trojan Rabbit idea is foiled by his own stupidity. However he has another idea for what Trojan animal?
Who was the only U.S. President to serve as both President and Chief Justice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Taft

questions.question: In the film Monty Python and the Holy Grail, which word is unbearable for the Knights of Ni to hear?
In the comedy Monty Python and the Holy Grail, the name of the enchanter, who can summon fire and who leads Arthur and his Knights to the Cave of Caerbannog, is Dan.
Franklin Roosevelt was the president who ordered the bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945.
Becoming the 22nd and 24th U.S. President, he was the only President to serve two nonconsecutive terms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleveland

questions.question: He was U.S. President when the first 7 states seceded from the Union.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Buchanan

questions.question: The villagers in the film Monty Python and the Holy Grail think  that they have found a witch! Sir Bedevere uses his new learning skills to help them determine if she is truly a witch. According to his logic, the girl is a witch if she weighs as much as which object?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A duck

questions.question: To provide with something desired or needed.  (verb)
Which two former U.S. Presidents died on the same day and on what day?

options.text: John Adams and Thomas Jefferson -- July 4, 1826
John Quincy Adams and Thomas Jefferson -- July 4, 1826
John Quincy Adams and Thomas Jackson -- July 4, 1826
Thomas Jefferson and James Monroe -- July 4, 1826

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams and Thomas Jefferson -- July 4, 1826

questions.question: Horses were too expensive for the Monty Python group to rent or buy for filming. What did they use instead?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Death and Noun
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, fiction, process. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Being a pizza-deliverer or a vending machine filler is actually very dangerous.
Not named or identified.  (adjective)
Being a fisherman can be quite dangerous. Fishermens most common cause of death is this.

options.text: Getting lost and dying of thirst

questions.question: What 1980s science fiction film is this quote from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War Games

questions.question: Directly accessible.  (adjective)
An antenna. (noun)
Position reaching from one side to the other.  (adverb)

According to the US Bureau of Labor Statistics, this was the most dangerous job in 1997.  With 118 victims out of 100,000 workers in the same year, this wood-bound profession is paid very well in order to attract workers.
Lacking skill.  (adjective)
Acknowledgment that a fact or statement is true.  (noun)
Being a pilot in one of these states is very perilous.
The process of taking in and making part of an existent whole.  (noun)
The most common cause of death for truck drivers is accidents on the road. This is what usually causes them.
A public notice. (noun)
An abnormality. (noun)

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Quote and Country
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, structure, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This quote is from what computer-animated film by the Blue Sky Studio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice Age

questions.question: Originally known as the Flavian Amphitheatre, this amphitheatre in Rome was once used for gladiatorial combat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Colosseum

questions.question: In this quote, the characters are referring to illicit drugs, i.e. speed, crank, cocaine.
Which country was not part of the Tripartite Pact signed on 27 September 1940?
The outbreak of World War II began with the German invasion of which European country?
The construction of this structure began on August 9, 1173 but after the third floor was built, it began to lean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leaning Tower of Pisa

questions.question: This large, half-human statue is situated at the west bank of the Nile River.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Sphinx of Giza

questions.question: Arc de Triomphe is a monument that stands in the centre of the Place de lÉtoile in this city.
Listen to the sound clip and name the 1987 film said to combine comedy, adventure, romance and fantasy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Princess Bride

questions.question: Which Academy Award-winning movie is this quote from?
The name of the Clock Tower of the Palace of Westminster in London is Craster Tower.
What 1987 Coen Brothers film is this quote from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raising Arizona

questions.question: The movie which contains the line on the sound clip is based on a Stephen King novella.
What 1990s western, written by Kevin Jarre and directed by George P. Cosmatos, is this quote from?
This ancient Chinese structure was built to protect China from raids by Mongol and Turkic tribes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Wall

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Dreams and Demeter
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Greek goddess of agriculture, Demeter, had a daughter called Persephone. What is the Persephones relation to Hades (the underworld god of wealth)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was his consort

questions.question: This type of dreaming occurs during waking hours when our level of awareness decreases and our mind wanders.
Some psychologists claim to encounter rare cases of people that never dream.
Which term refers to dreams in which you suddenly realize that you are dreaming?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lucid Dreams

questions.question: These are the dreams that repeat night after night with little variation in story or theme. These dreams may be pleasant, but most often they are nightmarish in content.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Recurring dreams

questions.question: He was the god of the sea.
Which of the following is not one of the nine Muses?
Chase dreams often derive from feelings of anxiety and pressure in your waking life.
One of Zeus lovers was Io. What kind of animal did Io turn into, when she tried to avoid detection?
Our normal sleep usually goes through the four stages of the sleep cycle. What is the name of the final stage, in which dreaming occurs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rapid Eye Movement

questions.question: How many extermination camps were built during WW II by the Nazis for the purpose of mass killing?
Originally Herakles labors were to be 11.
Cronus swallowed the first four children he sired by Rhea: Demeter, Hera, Hades and Hestia, as soon as they were born.
What was the main reason for the surrender of Japan on 15 August 1945?

options.text: The demolished ports and roads by Operation Starvation
The usage of atomic weapon against Japan
Invasion launched by Soviet Union in Manchuria
Air-raid and constant bombing over Tokyo

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The usage of atomic weapon against Japan

questions.question: Hermes was god of all these except one. Which is it?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Cat and Star
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, tabby, cartoon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The change of seasons can be explained with one of the following goddesses.
This red tabby cat appeared in the movies Breakfast at Tiffanys and The Comedy of Terrors.
This is the brightest star in the sky (after the Sun, of course) and is located in the constellation Canis Major.
Goddess Aphrodite was born out of this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea foam

questions.question: Which fictional cat was forever chasing Tweety Bird?
The home planet of Ford Prefect (from The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy) is said to be somewhere in the vicinity of this star. The star is also the second-brightest one in the constellation Orion.
Known as the worlds most finicky cat, he became the spokes-cat for Purinas 9 Lives cat food in 1969.
On 20 July 1969 Neil Armstrong became the first person to walk on the Moon. This is where he made his first steps.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea of Tranquility

questions.question: Created by Australian Pat Sullivan, this cat was the star of the first talkie cartoon.
Name the fat and lazy cat who hates Mondays.
The first person to use a telescope for astronomical purposes was Galileo Galilei.
He was the son of Hypnos.
This cat and Jerry, the ever-dueling duo, have chased each other from the Hollywood Bowl to Hungary, to outer space and back.
This white Chinchilla longhair became a movie star in such films as Diamonds are Forever and Clockwork Orange.
This elegant cartoon Persian cat was created for Walt Disneys 1970 animated feature, The Aristocats.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Constellation and Family
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, birds, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Southern Cross is a well known constellation in the Southern Hemisphere. It was illustrated as part of this constellation for many years, before it was identified as a separate one in 1592.
The Peregrine Falcon, one of Americas most spectacular flyers, was almost driven to extinction during the 1950s and 1960s. Which of these human activities caused this?

options.text: Extermination of the species it feeds on

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Usage of certain pesticides

questions.question: The older son in the family was nicknamed D.J.  What did his initials stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Jacob

questions.question: These birds are so well adapted to flying, that they have been observed flying for days without rest. Landing though seems to be a problem - their landings are often described as semi-controlled crashes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wandering Albatross

questions.question: The Sharp-shinned Hawk, a type of small hawk with short, broad wings and a long square-ended tail, are known for which of this flying abilities?

options.text: Sudden dives for prey in water
Soaring in the air for days without rest

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: High-speed, sharp turns in flight

questions.question: This open cluster can be found in the constellation of Taurus, and is known as M45. According to Greek mythology, seven of its brightest stars are sisters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pleiades

questions.question: This was NOT one of Jackies professions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mail Carrier

questions.question: To the Common Snipe, a type of small shorebird found in Canada, the United States, northern Europe and Russia, flying plays an important role in which of these processes?
This event caused Roseanne to proclaim that now,  they were OFFICIALLY white trash.

options.text: Dan drank white lightning and passed out.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dan went to jail.

questions.question: Saturn is the only planet in our solar system that has rings.
Engineers have discovered the Turkey Vulture, a species of brownish black vultures typical for the southern United States, to help them in which of these activities?

options.text: Locating cracked or broken underground fuel pipes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Locating cracked or broken underground fuel pipes

questions.question: Arrange the following stars according to their brightness as seen from Earth, starting with the brightest one:

The Andromeda Galaxy, also known as M31, is visible to the naked eye, but only when the sky is very dark. The Persian astronomer Abd-al-Rahman Al Sufi described it as a small cloud in 964, but years later it became clear that it was a galaxy of this kind.
This is the number of seasons Roseanne ran.
This was the City and State where the family lived.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lanford, Illinois
